705765f-a.text:
Montague Street, south side, west from Fulton Street.* At the extreme left, is the Continental Insurance Building, next to it the Old Academy of Music, next to it the Academy of Design. The trolley tracks are no longer on Montague Street. The clock on the right, was still keeping
time in (1936). This whole block has been renovated.
About 1890.
*should be Court St.
Eugene L. Armbruster Colleotion.
705765f-a.folder: Montague Street & Court Street, Brooklyn, NY

705763f-a.text:
Montague Street, north side, at and west of Court Street. Note the
dress of the policemen.
1900.
Eugene L Armbruster Collection.
705763f-a.folder: Montague Street & Court Street, Brooklyn, NY

703832f-a.text:
Court Street, west side, from Montague (right) to Remsen Streets. On the extreme right is the Mechanics Bank Building at the northwest corner of Court and Montague Streets. To the left of it, at the S.W. corner of the two streets, is the Continental Insurance Building (narrow buildfng) and the Phoenix Tnsurance Building. These two were torn down in 1926 and the 35-story Montague-Court Building erected on the site. The clearance to the left of the Phoenix Building, which is the northwest corner of Court and Remsen Streets, is the former site of the Garfield Building, where the 29-story Court-Remsen Building was later put up. The view is across Borough Hall Park from Fulton Street. The statue (center left) is that of Henry Ward Beecher, d'stinguished preacher of the Plymouth Church and
abolitionist.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection  1925
703832f-a.folder: Court Street & Montague Street, Brooklyn, NY

703831f-a.text:
A general view west from the Temple Bar Building located at the S.W. corner of Court and Montague Streets, showing the Brooklyn Heights section of Brooklyn between Remsen Street (extreme left) and Fulton Street (extreme rights). In the foreground is the Episcopal Church of the Holy Trinity at the N.W. corner of Montague and Clinton Streets. At the left background is the Hotel Bossert at the S.E. corner of Montague and Hicks Streets. Also shown is the Manhattan skyline and at the right a part of the Brooklyn Bridge. Note the junction of the East and North Rivers with Upper New York Bay. The New Jersey skyline vaguely appears in the left background.

1926.
Brown Brothers.
Neg. #5027
703831f-a.folder: Court Street & Montague Street, Brooklyn, NY

703835f-a.text:
16-26 Court Street, west side, between Montague and Remsen Streets, showing in the foreground, Borough Hall Park, and at the left part of the
Borough Hall Building.
May 1926.
Brown Brothers.
703835f-a.folder: Court Street & Montague Street, Brooklyn, NY

703834f-a.text:
Court Street, south from and including Montague Street.  In the foreground is the Court Street Station of the Fulton Street B.M.T. Elevated line. In the background is seen the Borough Hall Building, with its tower and clock; in back thereof is shown the new Municipal Building.
1928.
Pal1
703834f-a.folder: Court Street & Montague Street, Brooklyn, NY

703833f-a.text:
Court Street, south from, but not including Montague Street, showing a view of Borough Hall.
June 6, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
703833f-a.folder: Court Street & Montague Street, Brooklyn, NY

705764f-a.text:
Montague Street, north side, west from Court Street. At 197 is seen The Montague Street branch of the Brooklyn Public Library. The building was erected in 1867.
December 1925.
Brown Brothers.
NEO ~ 3107
705764f-a.folder: Montague Street & Court Street, Brooklyn, NY

705766f-a.text:
Montague Street, south side, west from Court Street, showing a rear view of the Academy of Music, opened in 1861 at a cost of over $200,000. It was destroyed by fire in 1903. At the right, is the steeple of the Church of the Holy Trinity. In the background is the Pierrepont Hotel.
1902.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
705766f-a.folder: Montague Street & Court Street, Brooklyn, NY
